title: Super Typhoon Fung-wong Targets Luzon, Philippines; Evacuations Underway
snippets: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, the biggest storm to threaten the Philippines this year, started battering the country's northeastern coast ahead of landfall on Sunday.
Philippines braces for Super Typhoon Fung-wong, still reeling from Kalmaegi Reuters
Typhoon Fung-wong with sustained winds of 185 km/h (115mph) is expected to make landfall on Sunday evening.
Philippines weather bureau warns of 'life-threatening conditions' as super storm heads for its largest island.

The Philippines is bracing for Fung-wong, set to be its biggest storm this year, just days after Typhoon Kalmaegi devastated the country. Almost a million people have been evacuated amid high winds and torrential rain.

Fung-wong was preparing to hit the Philippines just days after the country was battered by typhoon Kalmaegi which killed 204 people More than 900,000 people have been evacuated from eastern and northern regions of the Philippines as the latest storm to hit the country – Fung-wong – intensified on Su
Nearly a million people have been evacuated and floodwaters were rising in the Philippines on Sunday before Typhoon Fung-wong's expected late-night landfall on the east coast.
Typhoon Fung-wong is heading for the main island of Luzon, causing tens of thousands to be evacuated after another storm killed more than 200 last week.
titles: Nearly a million people evacuate as Super Typhoon Fung-wong threatens the Philippines
Philippines braces for Super Typhoon Fung-wong, still reeling from Kalmaegi - Reuters
Nearly a million evacuated as Philippines braces for 'super typhoon'
Super Typhoon Fung-wong approaches Philippines, nearly 1 million evacuated
Philippines: Tens of thousands evacuate as super typhoon nears
More than 900,000 evacuated in the Philippines as Fung-wong intensifies into super typhoon
Philippines evacuates hundreds of thousands as super typhoon nears
Philippines Braces for Typhoon Fung-Wong, While Still Reeling From the Last Storm
summary: Super Typhoon Fung-wong, with sustained winds of 185 km/h, is set to make landfall in the Philippines on Sunday evening, targeting the main island of Luzon. This comes shortly after Typhoon Kalmaegi resulted in 204 deaths. Nearly a million people have been evacuated from the eastern and northern regions due to the threat of life-threatening conditions, including high winds and torrential rain. The Philippines weather bureau has warned of severe impacts as the country braces for its biggest storm of the year.

title: US Airlines Cancel 2,500 Flights Amid Government Shutdown
snippets: US airlines cancel more than 2,500 weekend flights largely due to government shutdown AP News
The Federal Aviation Administration is temporarily cutting air traffic by 10 percent to maintain safety standards.
Airlines will have to slash hundreds of more flights if shutdown continues into next week.
The government shutdown is disrupting travel plans for thousands across the US. Follow the latest updates on the FAA's traffic reduction here.
titles: US airlines cancel more than 2,500 weekend flights largely due to government shutdown - AP News
Thousands of US flights cancelled, delayed as government shutdown continues
FAA-mandated flight cancellations to worsen next week if shutdown continues
Flight cancellation updates: FAA's government shutdown traffic reduction continues
summary: US airlines canceled over 2,500 flights during the weekend, mainly due to a government shutdown. The Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) has reduced air traffic by 10% to uphold safety standards. If the shutdown persists into the next week, airlines will need to cancel additional flights, affecting travel for thousands nationwide.

title: Avalanche Crush Oilers 9-1, MacKinnon Stars with 4 Points
snippets: Nathan MacKinnon had two goals and a pair of assists as the Western Conference-leading Colorado Avalanche embarrassed the Edmonton Oilers 9-1 on Saturday.
MacKinnon has 4 points, Avalanche score 9 to cruise past Oilers NHL.com

Nathan MacKinnon had a four-point night, Devon Toews picked up three assists, while Cale Makar, Parker Kelly, and Jack Drury each scored twice as the Colorado Avalanche dominated the Edmonton Oilers, winning 9-1.
titles: MacKinnon helps Avalanche crush Oilers 9-1
MacKinnon has 4 points, Avalanche score 9 to cruise past Oilers - NHL.com
NHL Highlights: Avalanche 9, Oilers 1
summary: Nathan MacKinnon led the Colorado Avalanche with two goals and two assists in a dominant 9-1 victory over the Edmonton Oilers. Devon Toews added three assists, while Cale Makar, Parker Kelly, and Jack Drury each scored twice, underlining the Avalanche's offensive prowess as they continue to lead the Western Conference.

title: Nield's Late TD Sends Roughriders to Grey Cup Over Lions
snippets: Tommy Nield's three-yard touchdown reception with 11 seconds left in the fourth quarter lifted the Saskatchewan Roughriders to a 24-21 victory over the B.C. Lions in the West Division final Saturday, sending the Riders to the Grey Cup.

Corey Mace’s boldest decision of the season came with the Saskatchewan Roughriders’ season on the line — and it paid off. Facing third down late in the fourth quarter and trailing by four, Mace made the bold decision to punt the ball away with 1:48 left on the clock, betting on his defence to deliver one more stop. The Riders’ defence forced a quick two-and-out, giving Trevor Harris one more chance — and the 39-year-old quarterback delivered when called upon. He marched the offence down the field, and found Tommy Nield in the endzone to stun Nathan Rourke and the B.C. Lions. It’s the type of...

Tommy Nield’s three-yard touchdown reception with 11 seconds left in the fourth quarter lifted the Saskatchewan Roughriders to a 24-21 victory over the B.C. Lions in the West Division final Saturday, sending the Riders to the Grey Cup. Trailing 21-17 with 1:03 left in the fourth quarter, the Riders

HAMILTON – Davis Alexander will carry a perfect record into the Grey Cup. He’ll bring a stingy defence along for the ride, too. The Montreal quarterback improved to 13-0 as a starter, and the Alouettes’ defence stood tall in a walk-off 19-16 win over the host Hamilton Tiger-Cats in the East final on
titles: Roughriders off to Grey Cup after beating Lions
Harris, Roughriders rise late against Lions to earn long-awaited Grey Cup shot
Roughriders advance to Grey Cup after win over Lions in West final
Alouettes advance to Grey Cup after beating Tiger-Cats in East Final
summary: Tommy Nield's late three-yard touchdown reception secured a 24-21 victory for the Saskatchewan Roughriders over the B.C. Lions in the West Division final, propelling them into the Grey Cup. In a strategic move, Coach Corey Mace chose to punt with 1:48 remaining, relying on his defense to regain possession. This decision paid off, allowing quarterback Trevor Harris to lead a successful final drive, culminating in Nield's game-winning catch with only 11 seconds left. The Riders will face the Montreal Alouettes, led by undefeated quarterback Davis Alexander, in the Grey Cup.

title: Messi Leads Inter Miami to Semifinals with 4-0 Win Over Nashville SC
snippets: Star forward Lionel Messi and Inter Miami advanced to MLS Cup East semifinals with Game 3 playoff win over Nashville.
The Herons won the series-clinching game on Saturday night, beating Nashville SC 4-0 in the decisive third game
Lionel Messi and Inter Miami are three wins away from an MLS Cup title.
titles: Messi scores two goals as Inter Miami eliminate Nashville in playoffs
Lionel Messi produces clutch goals, ridiculous nutmeg to keep Inter Miami alive in MLS Cup Playoffs
Messi leads Inter Miami to semifinals with two goals, two assists
summary: Lionel Messi and Inter Miami advanced to the MLS Cup Eastern Conference semifinals after defeating Nashville SC 4-0 in Game 3 of their playoff series. This victory puts them three wins away from the MLS Cup title.

title: FAA Halts MD-11 Flights; UPS, FedEx Ground Fleets After Crash
snippets: FAA bars MD-11 flights after fiery UPS jet crash Reuters
UPS, FedEx ground MD-11 fleets after deadly Louisville crash Reuters
The world's largest cargo carriers, UPS and FedEx, grounded their MD-11 freighter fleets at the recommendation of Boeing, the aircraft's manufacturer.
Delivery giants UPS and FedEx said they had made the decision to ground the fleet of aircraft after advice from the aircraft manufacturer.
titles: FAA bars MD-11 flights after fiery UPS jet crash - Reuters
UPS, FedEx ground MD-11 fleets after deadly Louisville crash - Reuters
UPS, FedEx ground planes after Louisville crash
FedEx and UPS have grounded their fleets of MD-11 cargo planes after the crash in Kentucky
summary: Following a fiery crash in Louisville, the FAA has barred MD-11 flights, leading UPS and FedEx, two of the world's largest cargo carriers, to ground their MD-11 fleets on Boeing's advice.

title: Infant Botulism Outbreak in 10 States Linked to Baby Formula, Recall Issued
snippets: Infant botulism in 10 US states linked to formula being recalled AP News
Federal and state health officials are investigating 13 cases in 10 states of infant botulism linked to baby formula that was being recalled, authorities said Saturday.
Baby Formula Recalled After Infant Botulism Outbreak Bloomberg.com
titles: Infant botulism in 10 US states linked to formula being recalled - AP News
Infant botulism in 10 US states linked to formula being recalled
Baby Formula Recalled After Infant Botulism Outbreak - Bloomberg.com
summary: Federal and state health officials are investigating 13 cases of infant botulism across 10 US states, linked to a specific baby formula. This has prompted a recall of the formula in question.

title: Elena Rybakina Wins First WTA Finals Crown in Riyadh
snippets: Red-hot Rybakina scorches Sabalenka for maiden WTA Finals crown Reuters

Former Wimbledon champion wins 6-3, 7-6 (0) Unbeaten Rybakina takes home £3.98m Elena Rybakina re-established herself as one of the significant players in women’s tennis as she closed out a week of devastating performances against the best in the world by completely overpowering Aryna Sabalenka to c
Elena Rybakina continued her resurgence by winning the WTA Finals 6-3 7-6 (7-0) in Riyadh against world No 1 Aryna Sabalenka.
titles: Red-hot Rybakina scorches Sabalenka for maiden WTA Finals crown - Reuters
Elena Rybakina sinks Aryna Sabalenka to claim WTA Finals and record prize
Rybakina claims WTA Finals title after thrashing top seed Sabalenka
summary: Elena Rybakina won the WTA Finals, defeating Aryna Sabalenka 6-3, 7-6 (7-0) in Riyadh. This victory marks Rybakina's first WTA Finals crown and highlights her resurgence in women's tennis. She remained unbeaten throughout the tournament and took home £3.98m in prize money.

title: FAI Calls for Israel's Suspension from UEFA Over Alleged Statute Violations
snippets: Irish governing body overwhelmingly backs call for UEFA to ban Israel Reuters
FAI calls for Israel's immediate suspension over its violation of UEFA's statutes in occupied Palestinian territory.

Republic of Ireland body alleges two statute violations FAI approved a resolution to submit a formal motion The Football Association of Ireland (FAI) has approved a resolution to submit a formal motion to Uefa urging it to ban Israel from European club and international competitions. The governing b
titles: Irish governing body overwhelmingly backs call for UEFA to ban Israel - Reuters
Irish football body overwhelmingly backs call for Israel’s ban from UEFA
Irish football chiefs pass vote seeking Uefa ban on Israel from European competition
summary: The Football Association of Ireland (FAI) has officially approved a resolution to submit a motion to UEFA, calling for the immediate suspension of Israel from European club and international competitions. This action is in response to allegations of Israel violating UEFA's statutes in occupied Palestinian territories.

title: Pfizer Buys Obesity Drug Firm Metsera for $10B, Outbids Novo Nordisk
snippets: Pfizer wins $10 billion bidding war for Metsera as Novo Nordisk exits Reuters
Pfizer to Buy Metsera for $10 Billion, Capping Bidding War Bloomberg.com

NEW YORK (AP) — U.S. pharmaceutical giant Pfizer signed a deal to purchase development-stage obesity drugmaker Metsera Inc., winning a bidding war against Novo Nordisk, the Danish drugmaker behind weight-loss treatments Ozempic and Wegovy. Metsera, based in New York, has no products on the market, b
titles: Pfizer wins $10 billion bidding war for Metsera as Novo Nordisk exits - Reuters
Pfizer to Buy Metsera for $10 Billion, Capping Bidding War - Bloomberg.com
Pfizer clinches deal for obesity drug developer Metsea after a bidding war with Novo Nordisk
summary: Pfizer has acquired New York-based Metsera Inc., a company specializing in obesity drugs but without any products currently on the market, for $10 billion. This purchase concludes a competitive bidding war with Danish pharmaceutical company Novo Nordisk.

title: Tanzania Arrests Opposition Leader Amid Election Protest Controversy
snippets: Tanzania police arrest senior opposition party official after deadly protests, target others Reuters

Chadema party says deputy secretary general arrested and calls election of incumbent president fraudulent Tanzanian authorities have detained a senior official from the main opposition party, Chadema, amid a spate of arrests in connection to deadly protests during elections last week. More than 1,00
African Union observers said the vote was not credible and that they had documented ballot box stuffing. The government has dismissed criticism of the process and said the election was fair.
titles: Tanzania police arrest senior opposition party official after deadly protests, target others - Reuters
Tanzania police arrest opposition party official after deadly election protests
Tanzania police seek to arrest opposition leaders after protests
summary: Tanzania police arrested a senior official from the opposition party, Chadema, following deadly protests linked to last week's elections. The party has denounced the reelection of the incumbent president as fraudulent. African Union observers have also questioned the credibility of the vote, citing instances of ballot box stuffing. However, the Tanzanian government insists the election was fair.

title: Indigenous Veterans Honored on Remembrance Day Amidst Treatment Disparities
snippets: Saturday's gathering on Indigenous Veterans Remembrance day allowed people to reflect on the sacrifices of Indigenous veterans and highlight how many have been treated differently than their non-Indigenous peers.
Indigenous Veteran's Day on Nov. 8 was an occasion to highlight and honour Indigenous veterans.
titles: Ottawa ceremony honours Indigenous veterans and reflects on reconciliation
Indigenous veterans' sacrifices at home and abroad recognized in Ottawa-area ceremony
summary: On Indigenous Veterans Remembrance Day, observed on Nov. 8, a gathering took place to honor the contributions and sacrifices of Indigenous veterans. The event also focused on the disparities in treatment between Indigenous and non-Indigenous veterans.

title: Perth Man Critically Injured in Highway 43 Single-Vehicle Crash
snippets: A 33-year-old Perth, Ont., man suffered life-threatening injuries in the single-vehicle collision Saturday morning, according to the Ontario Provincial Police.
Police said the westbound truck left Highway 43 west of Glenview Road early Saturday.
titles: Man in life-threatening condition after collision in Smiths Falls
Driver, 33, in life-threatening condition after crash near Smiths Falls
summary: A 33-year-old man from Perth, Ontario, sustained life-threatening injuries in a single-vehicle crash early Saturday morning. The incident occurred when his westbound truck veered off Highway 43, west of Glenview Road, as reported by the Ontario Provincial Police.

title: Former NHL Star Mel Bridgman Dies at 70
snippets: Former NHLer and Ottawa Senators general manager Mel Bridgman has died. He was 70.

Former NHLer and Ottawa Senators general manager Mel Bridgman has died. He was 70. The NHL Alumni Association announced his death on Saturday. The cause of death was not disclosed. Bridgman was the first overall pick in the 1975 NHL draft by the Philadelphia Flyers, where he spent his first six-plus
titles: Former NHLer, Senators GM Mel Bridgman dead at 70
Former NHLer, Ottawa Senators GM Mel Bridgman dead at 70
summary: Former NHL player and Ottawa Senators general manager Mel Bridgman passed away at the age of 70, as announced by the NHL Alumni Association. The cause of death was not provided. Bridgman, who was the first overall pick in the 1975 NHL draft by the Philadelphia Flyers, had a distinguished career before moving into management.

title: Kenyan Activists Detained in Uganda Return Home After 39 Days
snippets: Two Kenyan human rights activists have returned home after being secretly detained for 39 days in Uganda.
The two men, from the Free Kenya Movement, were in neighboring Uganda for a rally by presidential rival Bobi Wine when they were seized.
titles: Freed Kenyan activists allege mistreatment after month in Ugandan detention
Kenyan activists freed after monthlong Uganda abduction
summary: Two Kenyan human rights activists from the Free Kenya Movement, who were detained for 39 days in Uganda after attending a rally by presidential rival Bobi Wine, have safely returned home.

title: 6.7 Magnitude Earthquake Strikes Near Yamada, Japan; Tsunami Warning Issued
snippets: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake struck Sunday off Yamada, Japan, the USGS said.
A tsunami was expected to come ashore with a maximum height of about three feet after a 6.7-magnitude quake struck off Japan’s coast early Sunday evening.
titles: Tsunami advisory issued as strong earthquake strikes off Japanese coast
Japan Issues Tsunami Advisory After Strong Earthquake Off Its Coast
summary: A 6.7 magnitude earthquake hit off the coast of Yamada, Japan, on Sunday, according to the USGS. Following the quake, a tsunami warning was issued, predicting waves up to three feet in height.

title: US Government Shutdown Delays Jobs and Inflation Reports Amid Fed Challenges
snippets: Data Fog Intensifying for Fed as Shutdown Delays US Inflation Numbers Bloomberg.com

Two monthly jobs reports have fallen victim to the longest US government shutdown and a key inflation snapshot due in the coming week is also in jeopardy, illustrating a thickening data fog for a Federal Reserve that’s the most divided in recent memory.
titles: Data Fog Intensifying for Fed as Shutdown Delays US Inflation Numbers - Bloomberg.com
Data Fog Intensifying for Fed as Shutdown Delays US Inflation Numbers
summary: The longest US government shutdown has caused delays in releasing two monthly jobs reports and may also delay a key upcoming inflation report. This situation is creating challenges for the Federal Reserve, which is currently experiencing significant internal divisions.

title: Migrant Boat Sinks Near Malaysia-Thailand Border; 1 Dead, 10 Rescued
snippets: Migrant vessel sinks off Malaysia-Thailand border, hundreds missing Reuters
At least one person has died and 10 have been rescued after a boat carrying undocumented migrants sank. Two other boats have also been reported missing.
titles: Migrant vessel sinks off Malaysia-Thailand border, hundreds missing - Reuters
Hundreds missing as boat sinks near Malaysia-Thailand border
summary: A boat carrying undocumented migrants sank off the Malaysia-Thailand border, resulting in at least one death and 10 rescues. Additionally, two other migrant vessels are reported missing.

title: Jason Kelce Clarifies Comments on Canada After Podcast Clip Sparks Reactions
snippets: Former Philadelphia Eagles centre Jason Kelce says he didn’t mean to insult Canada when he questioned why he was supposed to care about the World Series in a podcast episode earlier this week.

Former Philadelphia Eagles centre Jason Kelce says he didn’t mean to insult Canada when he questioned why he was supposed to care about the World Series in a podcast episode earlier this week. Kelce issued the clarification on social media Friday after a clip of his “New Heights” podcast, which he h
titles: Jason Kelce says he didn’t mean to insult Canada with World Series comments
Jason Kelce says he didn’t mean to insult Canada with comments about World Series
summary: Jason Kelce, former Philadelphia Eagles center, clarified on social media that he did not intend to insult Canada after questioning his interest in the World Series on his "New Heights" podcast. The clarification came after a clip from the episode sparked reactions.

title: University of Stuttgart Develops High-Efficiency, Compact Laser
snippets: A team at the University of Stuttgart has engineered a compact short-pulse laser that achieves up to 80% efficiency—far surpassing current models. Their new multipass design reuses light within a small crystal, combining power and precision in a palm-sized system. It opens the door to portable, cost

Researchers have developed an innovative and versatile system designed for a new generation of short-pulse lasers. Lasers that produce extremely short bursts of light are known for their remarkable precision, making them indispensable tools in manufacturing, medical technology, and scientific resear
titles: Tiny laser could transform medicine and quantum science
How a Palm-Sized Laser Could Change Medicine and Manufacturing
summary: Researchers at the University of Stuttgart have developed a compact, short-pulse laser with up to 80% efficiency, significantly higher than existing models. By utilizing a new multipass design that recycles light within a small crystal, this palm-sized system combines high power with precision. This advancement promises to enhance applications in manufacturing, medical technology, and scientific research by making short-pulse lasers more portable and cost-effective.

title: Tornado Strikes Rio Bonito do Iguaçu, Brazil; 6 Dead, Major Damage Reported
snippets: Tornado flattens homes in Rio Bonito do Iguacu, with one official describing the destruction as akin to a 'war zone'.

A tornado accompanied by strong winds and heavy rain struck the southern Brazilian state of Parana, killing six people, the state government said on Saturday. The town of Rio Bonito do Iguaçu was hit hardest late Friday.
titles: Powerful tornado wrecks Brazil town, killing six and injuring hundreds
Tornado in Brazil kills 6, injures hundreds
summary: A tornado hit Rio Bonito do Iguaçu in Paraná, Brazil, causing significant destruction, described as a 'war zone'. It occurred late Friday, bringing strong winds and heavy rain. The state government reported six fatalities as a result of the disaster.

title: China Sees Unexpected Consumer Price Rise in October Amid Holiday Demand
snippets: China Consumer Prices Unexpectedly Rise on Holiday Demand Bloomberg.com
China’s consumer prices unexpectedly increased in October, as holidays during the month boosted travel, food and transport demand.
titles: China Consumer Prices Unexpectedly Rise on Holiday Demand - Bloomberg.com
China Consumer Prices Unexpectedly Rise on Holiday Demand
summary: In October, China experienced an unexpected rise in consumer prices, attributed to increased demand for travel, food, and transport during holiday periods, as reported by Bloomberg.com.

title: 19-Year-Old Critically Injured in Kingston Hit-and-Run
snippets: A 19-year-old pedestrian is in critical condition after they were struck by a vehicle in Kingston, Ont., according to the Kingston Police.

Police in Kingston continued to investigate Saturday after an apparent hit-and-run crash Friday night left a young man in critical condition. Police said in a release that a pedestrian had been struck by a vehicle on Johnson Street near Albert Street. Investigation revealed that the suspect vehicle
titles: Pedestrian in critical condition after Kingston hit and run
Kingston hit-and-run victim in critical condition
summary: A 19-year-old pedestrian is in critical condition after being struck by a vehicle in a hit-and-run incident in Kingston, Ont. The crash occurred on Johnson Street near Albert Street. Kingston Police are investigating the incident.

title: Ortiz Jr. Defeats Lubin with Second-Round Knockout, Eyes 154-Pound Division

Vergil Ortiz Jr. demolished Erickson Lubin with a second-round knockout, displaying dominant power from the opening bell in a fight that was never competitive.

title: Visa, Mastercard Near Settlement to Lower Merchant Fees

Visa, Mastercard Near Settlement of Dispute With Merchants: WSJ - Bloomberg.com
summary: Visa and Mastercard are reportedly close to settling a dispute with merchants, according to the Wall Street Journal. The settlement is expected to lower the fees that merchants pay to process transactions.

title: DNA Structure Co-Discoverer James D. Watson Dies at 97
snippets: James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97 AP News
James D. Watson, whose co-discovery of the twisted-ladder structure of DNA in 1953 helped light the long fuse on a revolution in medicine, crimefighting, genealogy and ethics, has died. He was 97.
titles: James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97 - AP News
James Watson, co-discoverer of the double-helix shape of DNA, has died at age 97
summary: James D. Watson, renowned for co-discovering the double-helix structure of DNA in 1953, a breakthrough that revolutionized medicine, crimefighting, genealogy, and ethics, has passed away at the age of 97.

title: Crispr Therapy Halves 'Bad' Cholesterol in Study, Shows Heart Disease Promise
snippets: CRISPR gene therapy slashes 'bad' cholesterol, triglycerides by half in small study Reuters
An experimental gene-editing therapy developed by Crispr Therapeutics is showing promise for treating heart disease.
titles: CRISPR gene therapy slashes 'bad' cholesterol, triglycerides by half in small study - Reuters
A Gene Editing Therapy Cut Cholesterol Levels by Half
summary: A small study reported by Reuters reveals that an experimental gene-editing therapy created by Crispr Therapeutics has significantly reduced 'bad' cholesterol and triglycerides by half, indicating potential for treating heart disease.
